intro: Apama racemosa, commonly known as the clustered apama, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are opposite and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Apama racemosa is often found in woodland and coastal areas, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
